Class Connect4Logic

java.lang.Object
Connect4Logic
public class Connect4Logic
extends java.lang.Object
Class serves as the logic for the Connect Four Game for 2 player Board games. The methods are designed to help with the implement of a GUI The class contains method for unit testing.
Version:
January 28, 2022
Author:
Calab Bahlbi

  • Constructor Details

    • Connect4Logic

      public Connect4Logic​(java.lang.String color1, java.lang.String color2, int rows, int columns)
      Starts a new game
      Parameters:
      color1 - A string that determines color of piece 1
      color2 - A string that determines color of piece 2
      rows - An in that displays rows
      columns - An int that displays columns

  • Method Details

    • isIs1playing

      public boolean isIs1playing()
      Determines who is playing.
      Returns:
      return a boolean value which determines if player 1 or player 2 is playing

    • round

      public int round​(int col)
      Parameters:
      col - which column did the user try to add a piece to
      Returns:
      -1: if unsuccessful an int of which row it was added to if successful

    • checkForWinnerInGUI

      public boolean checkForWinnerInGUI​(int column)
      Checks for the winner in the GUI
      Parameters:
      column - which column did the user try to add a piece to
      Returns:
      the winner and winning color

    • checkForWinner

      public boolean checkForWinner​(int col, java.lang.String winningColor)
      Checks for the winner
      Parameters:
      col - which column did the user try to add a piece to
      winningColor - what is the winning color of the player
      Returns:
      the winner and winning color

    • reset

      public void reset​(int rows, int columns)
      Resets the game and board
      Parameters:
      columns - which column did the user try to add a piece to
      rows - which row did the user try to add a piece to
